title: Emmerdale: Fans are convinced that sacked Asan N'Jie's character Ellis is going to DIE
text:
He was sacked from the soap last month after getting into a brawl with Jamie Lomas at the TV Choice Awards.

And Emmerdale fans are convinced they've figured out how the axed actor Asan N’Jie will depart the soap, after his character Ellis Chapman cut his arm on a rusty nail in Tuesday's show.

Taking to Twitter fans quickly predicted that Ellis will meet his maker after contracting sepsis from the wound, especially as his final scenes are expected to air in the next few weeks.

Scroll down for video

Meeting his maker: Emmerdale fans are convinced that axed actor Asan N’Jie will be killed off on the soap, after his character Ellis Chapman cut his arm on a rusty nail in Tuesday's show

In the scenes, Ellis was hard at work doing some manual labour when he suffered a deep cut on his arm.

Despite his brother Billy's concerns, Ellis insisted that he didn't need to seek medical attention for the cut, and bandaged it up without a thought.

The scene sparked social media speculation from fans that Ellis will meet his maker but contracting sepsis from the wound.

So far bosses are yet to reveal how Ellis will depart the soap, but it is expected to be abrupt given his sacking last month. The soap normally films six to eight weeks in advance.

Ouch! In a scene that aired on Tuesday night, Ellie suffered a cut on his arm after catching it on a rusty nail, but refused to go to the hospital

Nasty: Ellis' injury has sparked speculation among fans about how his character will leave the soap, following his abrupt sacking last week

Looks painful! Soap bosses are yet to reveal how Ellis will depart the soap, after he was abruptly axed last week

WHAT IS SEPSIS? Sepsis, known as the ‘silent killer’, strikes when an infection such as blood poisoning sparks a violent immune response in which the body attacks its own organs. It is the leading cause of avoidable death, killing at least 44,000 a year, and the Daily Mail has long campaigned for more awareness. If caught early, the infection can be controlled by antibiotics before the body goes into overdrive - ultimately leading to death within a matter of minutes. But the early symptoms of sepsis can be easily confused with more mild conditions, meaning it can be difficult to diagnose. Sepsis has similar symptoms to flu, gastroenteritis and a chest infection. These include: S lurred speech or confusion

lurred speech or confusion E xtreme shivering or muscle pain

xtreme shivering or muscle pain P assing no urine in a day

assing no urine in a day S evere breathlessness

evere breathlessness I t feels like you are dying

t feels like you are dying S kin mottled or discoloured Symptoms in children are: Fast breathing

Fits or convulsions

Mottled, bluish or pale skin

Rashes that do not fade when pressed

Lethargy

Feeling abnormally cold

It was previously thought that Ellis will leave Emmerdale to join his mum Jessie in Dubai.

One wrote: 'Oh! Is this leading to a sepsis storyline?' while another added: 'Could Ellis' leaving storyline be sepsis? After grazing his arm on a rusty nail.'

A third viewer also posted: 'Will Ellis get blood poisoning,' while another fan also posted: 'Please let that be how Ellis goes, killed by a nail.'

It's fine! Ellis brushed off his injury and simply covered it in a bandage, rather than seek medical attention in hospital

Concerned: He also brushed off the worries of his brother Billy and Dawn Taylor, who noticed the wound on his arm

Will he survive? Fans took to Twitter after watching the scenes to claim that Ellis will contract sepsis from the cut, setting the stage for his character to be killed off

Last month Asan was sacked from Emmerdale after getting into a brawl with Hollyoaks star Jamie at the TV Choice Awards.

The actor was seen throwing a punch at Jamie during an explosive fight in front of shocked onlookers, shouting: 'I'm going to f*****g kill you'.

Asan, who has been involved in a knife attack Emmerdale plot, could be heard shouting in a video obtained by the Mirror: 'Do you think you are a f*****g big man? I'm going to f*****g kill you. I'm going to f*****g knife you,' before attempting to take a swipe at Jamie.

Drama: Asan was sacked by ITV from his role as Ellis Chapman on Emmerdale after threatening to 'knife' Hollyoaks actor Jamie at the TV Choice Awards last month

After the Asan threw the punch, I'm A Celebrity's Malique Thompson-Dwyer ran into the room to intervene and bundle Jamie out.

According to reports, the pair had to be pulled apart by security twice at the Hilton Park Lane hotel in Mayfair, London, with Asan eventually being escorted off the premises by staff at around 11pm.

Emmerdale announced that Asan had been sacked from the soap two days after footage surfaced of the brawl.

An ITV spokesperson told MailOnline: 'Emmerdale suspended Asan N'Jie yesterday pending further investigation into an incident at a central London hotel on Monday night.

'ITV executives have met with him this morning and as a consequence Asan's contract has been terminated with immediate effect.'

Upsetting: The actor was seen throwing a punch at Jamie (pictured) during an explosive fight in front of shocked onlookers, and he was sacked two days after the footage emerged

In a further statement given to MailOnline, Asan said: 'My behaviour at the TV Choice Awards was completely unacceptable and very much out of character.

'I sincerely apologise to everybody who has been affected especially Jamie Lomas, the whole Emmerdale team, our audience, ITV, my family, and the organisers of the TV Choice Awards. I am devastated, +accept full responsibility for my actions and I am determined to learn from this.'

Asan's brawl with Jamie was reportedly sparked by a financial dispute with one of his co-stars.

A source told The Sun that Asan allegedly goaded Jamie into lashing out, as the Hollyoaks star was awaiting commission for working with the star in the early days of his career.

Gone: The actor's exit storyline was is expected to air in the coming weeks, and it had been reported that his character will leave the village to join his mum Jessie in Dubai

According to the source Jamie was managing Asan's co-star - who is yet to be named - at his First Take Acting school, and helped him land one of his first roles in Emmerdale.

The actor in question had decided to leave Jamie's agency, but is yet to pay the full commission. They said: 'Jamie had guided this young lad's career and was responsible for him landing a gig in Emmerdale.

'He is entitled to this money but it's currently the subject of a private and personal dispute.'

Explaining how the brawl started, the source added: 'Asan went up to Jamie and started goading him, saying things like, ''Alright, Jamie big b*****ks''.'

A representative for Hollyoaks also confirmed to MailOnline that the incident will not affect Jamie's return to the soap as Warren Fox in early 2020, after he briefly reprised the role earlier this year.
description: Actor Asan N'Jie was sacked from Emmerdale last month after getting into a brawl with Hollyoaks' Jamie Lomas. His exit scenes are expected to air in the next few weeks.
